bill.title: An act relating to miscellaneous criminal procedure amendments
bill.description: An act relating to miscellaneous criminal procedure amendments

history.action: Committee Bill read first time
Placed on Calendar for Notice on 3/9/16
Read Second Time
Rep. Grad of Moretown spoke for the committee on Judiciary
Third Reading Ordered
Read Third time and Passed
Read 1st time & referred to Committee on Judiciary
Entered on Notice Calendar
Favorable report with proposal of amendment by Committee on Judiciary
New Business/Second Reading
Favorable report with proposal of amendment by Committee on Judiciary
Unfinished Business/Second Reading
Favorable report with proposal of amendment by Committee on Judiciary
Unfinished Business/Second Reading
Favorable report with proposal of amendment by Committee on Judiciary
Unfinished Business/Second Reading
Favorable report with proposal of amendment by Committee on Judiciary
Unfinished Business/Second Reading
Favorable report with proposal of amendment by Committee on Judiciary
New Business/Third Reading
Proposal of amendment to be offered by Senator(s) Ashe, Benning, Nitka, Sears, and White
Read 2nd time, reported favorably with proposal of amendment by Senator Ashe for Committee on Judiciary
Proposal of amendment by Committee on Judiciary agreed to
3rd reading ordered
Pending third reading, Senator(s) Sears, Ashe, Benning, Nitka, and White motion to amend proposal of amendment; text
Motion agreed to
Pending third reading, Senator(s) Sears, Ashe, Benning, and White motion to amend proposal of amendment; text
Motion to amend Senate proposal of amendment agreed to on roll call, requested by Senator Campbell Passed -- Needed 14 of 27 to Pass -- Yeas = 17, Nays = 10
Pending third reading, Senator(s) Sears, Ashe, Benning, and White motion to amend proposal of amendment; text
Motion to amend Senate proposal of amendment agreed to on roll call, requested by Senator Campbell Passed -- Needed 15 of 28 to Pass -- Yeas = 16, Nays = 12
Read 3rd time & passed in concurrence with proposal of amendment on roll call, requested by Senator Flory, Passed -- Needed 15 of 28 to Pass -- Yeas = 16, Nays = 12
Senate message passed in Concurrence with proposal of amendment
Rep. Grad of Moretown moved to postpone action until 5/3/16 which was agreed to
Senate proposal of amendment considered

Rep. Conquest of Newbury, Copeland-Hanzas of Bradford, Komline of Dorset, Olsen of Londonderry, and Young of Glover moved to concur with the Senate Proposal of Amendment to the House Proposal of Amendment with a further amendment thereto
Rep. Conquest of Newbury asked that the question be divided
First Instance of amendment agreed to
Roll Call Results Passed -- Needed 75 of 149 to Pass -- Yeas = 121, Nays = 28
Rep. Turner of Milton moved to substitute an amendment
Which was disagreed to
Roll Call Results Failed -- Needed 75 of 148 to Pass -- Yeas = 51, Nays = 97
Rep. Copeland-Hanzas of Bradford asked that the question be divided
Rep. Tate of Mendon moved that the bill be committed to the committee on Agriculture and Forest Products which was not agreed to.
First Instance of amendment disagreed to
Roll Call Results Failed -- Needed 74 of 147 to Pass -- Yeas = 70, Nays = 77
Rep. Wright of Burlington asked that the question be divided
First Instance of amendment agreed to
Rep. Hubert of Milton moved that the bill be committed to the committee on Government Operations which was not agreed to.
Rep. Conquest of Newbury moved to amend the proposal of amend offered by Rep. Conquest of Newbury
Which was agreed to
Rep. Branagan of Georgia moved to commit the bill to the committee on Ways and Means
Rep. Nuovo of Middlebury moved to postpone action until 5/4/2016
Rep. Nuovo of Middlebury asked leave to withdraw motion
Which was agreed to
Rep. Branagan of Georgia asked leave to withdraw motion
Which was agreed to
All remaining instances of amendments agreed to
Roll Call Results Passed -- Needed 73 of 145 to Pass -- Yeas = 77, Nays = 68
House message House concurred in Senate proposal of amendment with proposal of amendment
Motion by Senator Baruth to suspend rules to take bill up for immediate consideration disagreed to on division Yeas 15, Nays 11, the requisite 3/4ths majority (20) not attained
Entered on Notice Calendar
House proposal of amendment to Senate proposal of amendment
Proposal of amendment to be offered by Senator(s) Sears
House proposal of amendment to Senate proposal of amendment, text
Proposal of amendment by Senator(s) Sears; text
Senate message, House proposal of amendment concurred in with further amendment thereto
Rep. Turner of Milton moved to suspend rules and take up bill for immediate consideration
Which was agreed to
Senate proposal of amendment considered
Senate Proposal of Amendment concurred in
Rules suspended and bill messaged forthwith to the Senate as moved by Rep. Turner of Milton
Rules suspended & taken up for immediate consideration, on motion of Senator Campbell
House proposal of amendment concurred in with proposal of amendment, on motion of Senator Sears
Rules suspended & messaged to House forthwith, on motion of Senator Campbell
House message House concurred in Senate proposal of amendment to House proposal of amendment
Delivered to the Governor on 5/25/16
Signed by Governor on 5/25/16
